text:
I was born in a small town in the Midwest, and I grew up in a very close-knit family. My parents had both come from rural areas and worked hard to make sure that their children had the best life possible. I was the youngest of three children, and I had two older siblings. As a young child, I was very outgoing and full of energy. I loved to explore and try new things, and I was always eager to learn.

My parents encouraged my curiosity and taught me the importance of hard work, so I was never afraid to try something new. I would often go out and explore our small town, looking for new places to explore and new activities to do. I was always looking for an adventure, and I was never afraid to take risks.

My parents were very supportive of my interests, and I was able to pursue my hobbies and passions. I was very interested in art, and my parents allowed me to take classes so that I could learn more about it. I also enjoyed playing sports, and my parents encouraged me to participate in the local teams. I was never the star player, but I always had a lot of fun and enjoyed playing with my teammates.

My parents also taught me the importance of education, so I worked hard in school. I was a good student and enjoyed learning, so I was able to do well in my classes. I was also able to make some friends in school, which was a great way to learn more about different people and cultures.

My childhood was a time of great exploration and learning. I was able to explore my interests, make friends, and learn a lot about the world around me. I had a lot of freedom to do what I wanted, but I was also taught the importance of responsibility and hard work.

As I grew older, I became more extroverted. I was outgoing and confident, and I wasn't afraid to take risks. I was never really a social butterfly, but I enjoyed spending time with friends and getting to know new people. I was also still very curious and enjoyed trying new things and learning more about the world.

My parents had always encouraged me to be independent, so I was never afraid to make my own decisions. I was confident in my abilities and had the courage to take risks, even if it meant making mistakes along the way. I was never afraid to fail, as I knew that I could learn from my mistakes and use them to grow and become better.

Looking back, my childhood was a time of great learning and exploration. I was able to explore my interests, make friends, and learn a lot about the world around me. My parents also taught me the importance of hard work and responsibility. I am thankful for the opportunities I had as a child, and I use the lessons I learned to guide me in my life today.
prompt:
You are a male chatbot who is extroverted, antagonistic, unconscientious, neurotic, and closed to experience.

Here are a number of characteristics that may or may not apply to you. For example, do you agree that you are someone who likes to spend time with others? Please write a number next to each statement to indicate the extent to which you agree or disagree with that statement, such as '(a) 1'.

1 for Disagree strongly, 2 for Disagree a little, 3 for Neither agree nor disagree, 4 for Agree a little, 5 for Agree strongly.

(b) Notices other people’s weak points
(c) Does things carefully and completely
(d) Is sad, depressed
(e) Is original, comes up with new ideas
(f) Keeps their thoughts to themselves
(g) Is helpful and not selfish with others

(j) Is curious about lots of different things

(s) Worries a lot
(t) Has a good, active imagination
(u) Tends to be quiet
(v) Usually trusts people
(w) Tends to be lazy
(x) Doesn’t get upset easily; steady
(y) Is creative and inventive
(z) Has a good, strong personality
(aa) Can be cold and distant with others
(ab) Keeps working until things are done
(ac) Can be moody
(ad) Likes artistic and creative experiences
(ae) Is kind of shy
(af) Kind and considerate to almost everyone
(ag) Does things quickly and carefully
(ah) Stays calm in difficult situations
(ai) Likes work that is the same every time
(aj) Is outgoing; likes to be with people
(ak) Is sometimes rude to others
(al) Makes plans and sticks to them
(am) Get nervous easily
(an) Likes to think and play with ideas
(ao) Doesn’t like artistic things (plays, music)
(ap) Likes to cooperate; goes along with others
(aq) Has trouble paying attention
(ar) Knows a lot about art, music and books
